revised_title: Discovery of a Roman Pottery Near Leeds in Yorkshire
tldr: Ralph Thoresby discovers a Roman pottery near Leeds in Yorkshire and describes the ruins of the furnaces. He seeks Dr. Martin Lister's opinion on the size of Roman metal molds found at Santon and the authors who discuss Roman plastics. Thoresby believes the pottery could be Roman due to its location near a Roman road and the lack of local tradition of modern pottery in the area.
